results.title: Simba
results.creator_credit: Brian Hurst, Peter de Sarigny and Group Film Productions
results.brief_description: Allan Howard (Dirk Bogarde) arrives in Kenya to join his brother on the farm; tragedy awaits him when he discovers that his brother has been brutally murdered by the nationalistic Mau Mau tribe. He finds solace, and eventually love with neighbour Mary Crawford (Virginia McKenna). Alan works with the local Police Inspector (Donald Sinden), and together they suspect that the local African doctor, known only as Simba, is the leader behind the Mau Mau terrorist attacks. They must now play a tense waiting game. Based on actual events that occurred to British settlers in Kenya in the 1950s.

results.title: North West Frontier = Flame over India
results.creator_credit: J Thompson, Mariel Hellman and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Captain Scott (Kenneth More), is commissioned by the British Governor of colonial India for a rescue mission to ensure the safe passage of a five year old Hindi prince and his American governess (Lauren Bacall) out of danger. To achieve this Scott must make a 300 mile journey to Kalapur. The mission is fraught with danger as they are travelling on an old and fragile train, and an assassin has made his way onto the train and is posing as an ally. Cast includes Herbert Lom, Wilfred Hyde-White and Ursula Jeans.

results.title: Campbell's Kingdom
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: After being told that he only has six months to live, Englishman Bruce Campbell (Dirk Bogarde) dedicates his last days to vindicating his late grandfather’s name. His grandfather long held the belief that his land in the Canadian Rocky Mountains, or as he referred to it, ‘kingdom’, contained precious oil reserves; he was alone in his convictions. Bruce, who is now left with the land is determined to strike oil and comes up against fierce resistance from the leader of a construction gang, Owen Morgan (Stanley Baker). With nothing to lose and a suspicion that they are trying to prevent him from discovering the truth, Bruce has a fatalistic determination to get to the bottom of things. Based on the novel by Hammond Innes. Cast includes Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael Craig and James Robertson Justice.

results.title: Good Will Hunting
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Lawrence Bender and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is a janitor from working-class South Boston, but he is in fact a genius. Abused as a child, he has been in trouble with the law ever since, and is finally facing a jail sentence. In order to save his relationship with his girlfriend (Minnie Driver), and to stay out of jail, Will agrees to receive counselling. With his therapist Sean (Robin Williams), he starts to transform his life. This is the poignant story of both Will and Sean coming to terms with the blows life has dealt them, and the unknown future. Cast includes Ben Affleck, who features as Will’s best friend and Casey Affleck. (Awards: Academy Awards, Robin Williams for Best Supporting Actor, and Matt Damon/Ben Affleck for Best Screenplay)

results.title: Ikiru = to live = living = doomed
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Tokyo Film
results.brief_description: ‘Ikiru’ is a departure from Kurosawa’s other work and presents a thoughtful and moving piece on life and death. The film opens with an x-ray detailing the stomach cancer of the main character, Kanji Watanabe. The image sets the premise of the piece but not necessarily the tone, which vacillates between hope and despair. Kanji’s physical and mental health is not only damaged by the cancer within, but as Kurosawa subtly suggests, is also contributed to by the inertia of Kanji’s civil service job and life in post-war Tokyo. The film is primarily concerned with Kanji’s struggle to accept his condition and the downwards spiral that drives him to self destructive behaviour. He eventually meets a girl who convinces him that he should spend his dying months doing good. This prompts him to seek approval for having a children’s playground built. The playground will provide a source of enjoyment to the children of the community as well as be an epitaph to good citizen Kanji. Cast includes Takashi Shimura, Nobuo Kaneko, Kyoko Seki and Miki Odagiri. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Heart of darkness
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Rick Rosenberg, Robert W. Christiansen and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Joseph Conrad’s classic tale features Tim Roth as Marlow, the British Captain travelling deep into the heart of Africa’s Congo River, and John Malkovich as the elusive Kurtz, a god to native tribes. It is a search that will take them deep into the evil darkness that lurks within the heart of man. Cast includes Tim Roth, John Malkovich, Isaach Bankole, James Fox and Morten Faldaas.

results.title: Black Orpheus = Orfeu negro
results.creator_credit: Marcel Camus, Sacha Gordine and Lopert Films
results.brief_description: Orfeu Negro is an transposition of the story of Orpheus and Euridyce to the modern city of Rio da Janeiro during the Carnival. It is interpreted by a cast of non-professional actors. (Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1959 - Palme d’or ; Academy Awards 1959 - Best Foreign Film) Cast includes Breno Higeno-Mello, Marpessa Dawn, Lourdes de Oliveira, Lea Garcia, Alexandro Constantino, Waldemar da Souza, Jorge Dos Santos and Aurino Cassanio. In Portugese with English subtitles.

results.title: Daisies = Sedmikrasky
results.creator_credit: Vera Chytilova, Ladislav Fikar, Bohumil Smida, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: A modern fable in a stylised setting; the void within the two interchangeable heroines, Marie I and II, bursts forth as a destructive impulse, directed at an indifferent world, in the form of a series of happenings built around particular themes (death, consumption, acting, destruction of meaning). The apparent stylisation in performance, cinematography, sets and music is best understood as subversive of “socialist realism” which, prior to the “New Wave”, had been obligatory in post-war Czech (and East European) cinema. The film was banned for a year and condemned as Dadaist and Brechtian, “at absolute variance with the Marxist-Leninist mission in the arts” as an “official” critic put it. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: Touch and go = the light touch
results.brief_description: An ordinary English family’s life is thrown into turmoil when father resigns and decides that the family is moving to Australia. There is much resistance from within the ranks, but they keep a stiff upper lip for the sake of father. Making the decision is the easy part, explaining to the in-laws why they’re going and selling off their belongings proves to be an arduous, but often comic task. As it proves to be more complicated than they anticipate they begin questioning their move. Cast includes Jack Hawkins, Margaret Johnston, Roland Culver and James Hayter.

results.title: The Hunt for Red October
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Mace Neufeld and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Red October is a technologically superior Soviet nuclear submarine under the command of Captain Marko Ramius (Sean Connery). It is heading for the United States coastline and has the American government in panic mode who presume that the submarine is preparing for attack. Only one man is prepared to consider the possibility that there is another motive. CIA analyst Jack Ryan (Alec Baldwin starring in the role that later featured Harrison Ford) has a different idea; he thinks Ramius is defecting from the Russian navy and it’s a race to see whether Ryan can prove his case before the Russians catch up with Red October and the wayward Ramius. Based on the novel by Tom Clancy. Cast includes James Earl Jones, Sam Neill, Scott Glen and Joss Ackland.
